intro: Cuphea ingrata var. platensis, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a tropical shrub native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in dense clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract hummingbirds.
